info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 9:12PM EST until January 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in North Carolina... French Broad River At Blantyre affecting Henderson and Transylvania Counties. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 4-6 inches of rainfall across the upper French Broad River watershed from early Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across Transylvania and Henderson counties, with several tributaries of the French Broad River expected to exceed bankfull and cause Minor to Moderate flooding of adjacent areas as early as Tuesday morning. This excessive flow will cause the upper French Broad River from Rosman downstream to Brevard, Blantyre, Etowah, and Fletcher to exceed Minor Flood Stage late Tuesday morning into Tuesday afternoon and Moderate Flood Stage by Wednesday morning. This will result in significant and damaging inundation within the river valley impacting farmland, numerous flood-prone roadways, and possibly some structures including outbuildings, barns, crawl spaces, and basements. Flooding may persist into Thursday afternoon. Residents are advised to move vulnerable property to higher ground and stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...French Broad River at Blantyre. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Moderate Flood Stage. Extensive flooding of the upper French Broad River Valley is ongoing, resulting in significant farmland inundation and affecting several roads between Rosman and Horse Shoe. Parts of Lyons Mountain Rd, Hannah Ford Rd, Green Rd, Island Ford Rd, Barclay Rd, Wilson Rd, Poplar Ln, River Rd, Pleasant Grove Rd, Butler Bridge Rd, and Big Willow Rd are likely inundated by at least 1-3 feet of floodwaters. Floodwaters may be threatening a trailer park on River Ridge Rd. Floodwaters may be approaching buildings north of Grove Bridge Road along US 64. Associated tributaries, including Little River, are likely flooding due to high water levels on the French Broad River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Monday the stage was 7.5 feet and falling slowly. - Action/Advisory Stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage by tomorrow evening. The river is expected to exceed Moderate Flood Stage by Wednesday morning, cresting at 19.1 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage Thursday morning. The river may exceed Minor Flood Stage earlier than currently forecast due to the potential for intense rainfall rates. The river may rise above the forecasted crest. Please closely monitor the latest levels and forecasts. - Minor Flood Stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Thursday evening at 700 PM EST.
